summary: This document is the Metropolitan Correctional Center's daily lieutenant's log for July 13, 2019, detailing routine operations, inmate counts, and security checks. It notes inmates on psychological observation and suicide watch, and records the transfer of an inmate to the hospital. The log covers three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch) and shows a stable inmate population count of 798.

persons.name: Captain Darden
persons.context: Mentioned as authorizing the transfer of an inmate to the hospital annex (HA) due to no bed space in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Inmate Transfer to Hospital Annex
events.description: An inmate was transferred to the Hospital Annex (HA) as per Captain Darden's order, due to no bed space available in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Routine Prison Operations and Counts
events.description: Standard prison operations including multiple institutional counts, body alarm tests, equipment checks, and religious services were conducted throughout the day across three shifts.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The log records activities for July 13, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found injured in his cell (he died by suicide on July 10, 2019, so this log is from three days after his death).
Inmate population was stable at 798, with 76 in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
Multiple inmates were noted as being on psychological observation and suicide watch with inmate companions.
An inmate was transferred to the Hospital Annex on the order of Captain Darden due to lack of SHU bed space.
The log shows routine security procedures including body alarm tests, metal detector checks, and PREA announcements (when the system was functional).
